subject: OS-7209 Copy minor upstream nawk(1) code changes Reviewed by: Robert Mustacchi <rm@joyent.com> Approved by: Jason King <jbk@joyent.com>
commitMessage:
OS-7209 Copy minor upstream nawk(1) code changes
Reviewed by: Robert Mustacchi <rm@joyent.com>
Approved by: Jason King <jbk@joyent.com>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.
Uploaded patch set 2.
Uploaded patch set 3.

Patch Set 3:

(4 comments)

In general looks good. There are a few questions I have. I'm not sure how much it's worth changing these at this phase given the future changes coming, etc.
Uploaded patch set 4.

Patch Set 4:

(4 comments)

Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)
Uploaded patch set 5.

Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)

I realized that when I did OS-7046, I unfortunately included files in the manifest that are added in this commit and in the upcoming CR for OS-7261. I've fixed it to accurately reflect the state of the tests for this commit. If I should fix it in a separate ticket first instead, let me know.
Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1
Uploaded patch set 6.
Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1
Uploaded patch set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased.
Uploaded patch set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased.
Topic set to nawk-update
Patch Set 8: Integration-Approval+1
Uploaded patch set 9: Commit message was updated.
Uploaded patch set 10: Patch Set 9 was rebased.
Uploaded patch set 11: Patch Set 10 was rebased.
Change has been successfully merged by Cody Peter Mello
These really should be NULL.
Done here and in several other files. I also replaced 0 with '\0' where appropriate.
In general, I wouldn't touch others copyrwite statements and move them around.
I've put these back, and also put the Alcatel Lucent copyright notices into these files.
Why is this a strncmp()? This would make it seem like --foo would match and become an explicit end of args.

Yes, this seems like a bug. I've fixed it in this CR (so that it's not introducing a regression), and also submitted a fix upstream:

https://github.com/onetrueawk/awk/pull/21
A bunch of users of this just pass it to printf(). Should we just put unknown or something else?

The callers check whether it's NULL to determine whether to try and print the "source file ..." part:

https://cr.joyent.us/#/c/4861/3/usr/src/cmd/awk/lib.c@526
https://cr.joyent.us/#/c/4861/3/usr/src/cmd/awk/lib.c@621
cast is unnecessary, but I assume it's upstream so it's OK.
Were these expand_buf to adjbuf calls just something that was missed in the original passes?

I had initially placed these in the commits I was going to squash into the next CR, but I decided it'd be better to just place it in this one, since I also put other expand_buf -> adjbuf changes in this one.
